verbose_text: XREF_BIBR In addition to the stimulating effect of epinephrine binding to beta-adrenergic receptors on the sarcolemma, muscle contraction produces a variety of metabolites, such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine monophosphate (AMP), and inosine monophosphate (IMP), along with increased levels of calcium and inorganic phosphate, which also enhance the activity of glycogen phosphorylase.
evidence: phosphate, which also enhance the activity of glycogen phosphorylase
